Package koopa.core.grammars.combinators

package koopa.core.grammars.combinators
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    koopa.core.grammars
     
    koopa.core.grammars.fluent
     
  • Class
    Description
    Dispatched
    This is kind of an optimizing ParserCombinator which can choose directly between a selection of many ParserCombinators by looking at the very next Grammar.keyword() in the stream.
    GrammaticalCombinator
    A ParserCombinator which uses Grammar knowledge.
    MatchAny
    Accepts any and all tokens.
    MatchEndOfFile
    Accepts when the token stream is at the end of the input (ignoring separators).
    MatchKeyword
    Accepts Grammar.keyword() if its match covers the given text.
    MatchLiteral
    A ParserCombinator which looks for a literal match of a single Token's text.
    MatchNumber
    Accepts a single token if it is tagged with SyntacticTag.NUMBER and its text matches the given text.
    MatchToken
    Accepts a single token if its text matches the given text.
    OptimizingChoice
    This ParserCombinator is equivalent to a Choice, except that it checks to see if it can use lookahead to speed up picking the right alternative.
    OptimizingPermuted
    This ParserCombinator is equivalent to a Permuted, except that it checks to see if it can use lookahead to speed up picking the right alternative.
    Scoped
     
    Scoped.Visibility
    Choices for visibility of Markers.
    TestForCase
    This ParserCombinator tests whether the text matched by a given parser is in a given case or not.
    TestForKeyword
    This ParserCombinator tests whether the text matched by a given parser is a keyword or not.
    TestProgramText
    This ParserCombinator provides the basis for testing the AreaTag.PROGRAM_TEXT_AREA matched by a given parser.
    TestRange
    Checks whether the position of the following token in the stream lies within a certain range.
    TestTag
    Checks whether the following token in the stream has a given tag.
    WithKeyword
    This ParserCombinator provides the basis for others which want to know the Grammar.keyword() at the point in the Parse where they're being applied.
    WrappedAs
